main event: An unidentified flying object was observed at Stewart Air Force Base, New York, on January 12, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as unusually bright and brilliant white, larger than a star,The object displayed rapid ascension and erratic movement, prompting the observer to suspect it was not a conventional aircraft,Two Air Force officers confirmed the sighting,There were no local aircraft taking off or landing at the time, and no weather balloons were released during the observation period.
witness description: Two Air Force Officers with no previous aerial observer experience.
